intro: Elisanthe hoefftiana, commonly known as the rock dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by fluffy, white seed heads resembling dandelion fluff. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Elisanthe hoefftiana is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and resilience.
